column4: Fitch Solutions: Macy's CDS at Widest Level in Three Years
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  November 11 (Fitch) An unseasonably warm autumn is leading out credit  default swap (CDS) spreads for Macy's  Inc. to levels not seen since 2012   according to Fitch Solutions in its latest CDS case study snapshot. Five-year CDS on Macy's widened out 16% over the past week and are now trading  140% wider than they were at the start of the year. As a result  the cost of  credit protection on Macy's debt is at its widest levels

column5: Nov 11 U.S. stock index futures were higher on Wednesday after mixed economic data out of China suggested that Beijing may need to provide further stimulus to kickstart growth  even as investors brace for a possible rise in U.S. interest rates next month.

column4: MUFG  Mizuho banks sell 160 bln yen worth of Japan Post shares to individuals
column5: TOKYO  Nov 11 Banks under Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc and Mizuho Financial Group Inc  sold a total 160 billion yen ($1.3 billion) of shares to individual investors in the Japan Post triple IPO  sources with knowledge of the matter said.

column5: Blackstone Group LP  has agreed to invest more than $800 million in NCR Corp  that will give it the equivalent of more than a 15 percent stake in the automated teller machines maker  a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Occidental to sell Zubair stake to Iraq's South Oil: officials
column5: BASRA  Iraq Occidental Petroleum Corp  the fourth-largest U.S. oil producer  will sell its stake in the 4-billion-barrel Zubair oilfield to Iraq's state-run South Oil Company (SOC)  Iraqi oil officials said on Wednesday.

column4: Pearson CEO says 'sustaining' the dividend his priority
column5: BARCELONA Pearson's chief executive John Fallon said on Wednesday he considered protecting his company's dividend a top priority as the world's largest educational publisher struggles with slowdowns in most of its major markets.

column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Nov 11 The administrative restructuring and consolidation of Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras will be finished in February  a member of the company's board said on Wednesday.

column4: Brazil says halts production at P-37 platform after leak reported
column5: SAO PAULO  Nov 11 Brazil's state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA said on Wednesday it halted production at the Campos Basin's P-37 platform  which produces 30 000 barrels of oil a day  after an oil workers' union reported a leak.

column4: Petrobras cancels oil strike talks  union vows escalation
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA canceled talks with union leaders that were planned for Tuesday and aimed at settling a strike that is now in its ninth day.

column4: Argentina's Supreme Court orders YPF to disclose Chevron contract
column5: BUENOS AIRES Argentina's Supreme Court on Tuesday ordered the state-controlled energy firm YPF to fully disclose its contract with Chevron Corp amid allegations of secret clauses in the agreement.
